ch.epfl.lis.wingj.structure.drosophila.wingpouch

Class WPouchStructure

  • java.lang.Object
    • ij.process.FloatPolygon
      • ch.epfl.lis.wingj.structure.Compartment
        • ch.epfl.lis.wingj.structure.Structure
          • ch.epfl.lis.wingj.structure.drosophila.wingpouch.WPouchStructure
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EmbryoStructure

    public class WPouchStructure
extends Structure
    This class describes the structure of the Drosophila wing pouch.

    The wing pouch structure is composed of:

    • Dorsal-ventral boundary (D/V)
    • Anterior-posterior boundary (A/P)
    • Dorsal-anterior compartment (DA)
    • Dorsal-posterior compartment (DP)
    • Ventral-anterior compartment (VA)
    • Ventral-posterior compartment (VP)

    Conventions

    • The wing pouch center is defined as the intersection of the A/P and D/B boundary.
    • The D/V boundary corresponds to the A-P axis.
    • The A/P boundary corresponds to the V-D axis.
    • The D/V boundary starts at the V side.
    • The A/P boundary starts at the A side.
    • The contour of the DA compartment starts at the wing pouch center direction Dorsal.
    • The contour of the DP compartment starts at the wing pouch center direction Posterior.
    • The contour of the VP compartment starts at the wing pouch center direction Ventral.
    • The contour of the VA compartment starts at the wing pouch center direction Anterior.
    • The D/V boundary makes a U (bottom of the U oriented to Ventral).
    • The A/P boundary makes a C (left side of the C oriented to Posterior).
    • Physical units are given by the meta-information of the input images and are typically [um] and [um^2] for area.
    Version:
    February 20, 2013
    Author:
    Thomas Schaffter (thomas.schaff...@gmail.com), Ricard Delgado-Gonzalo (ricard.delg...@gmail.com)

      • align

        public void align(Structure reference)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Rotates the current structure in such a way that the quadratic difference of the angles formed by the four axis between both structures is minimized. Both structures need to be in canonical orientation. In addition, the structure is moved so that its centroid is centered with the centroid of the reference structure.
        Specified by:
        align in class Structure
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • write

        public void write(java.net.URI uri)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Save to file the data required to reconstruct the structure. Here the data are 1) a list of nodes required to create the snake structure and 2) the center of gravity of each of the four compartment to obtain the information about the orientation of the structure.
        Specified by:
        write in class Structure
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getExpressionTrajectory

        public double getExpressionTrajectory(Boundary trajectory,
                             int referenceBoundary,
                             double offset)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Computes a Boundary trajectory along which expression can be measured (passed by reference). First, the offset is used to translate the trajectory from the reference boundary. The boundary is then cropped using THIS structure. The double value returned is the length of the negative part in the current unit. For instance, Boundary.length() returns the value in the correct unit.

        IMPORTANT: The first boundary convention is used, that is the D point is the

        Specified by:
        getExpressionTrajectory in class Structure
        Parameters:
        trajectory - Trajectory along which expression will be measured.
        referenceBoundary - Takes value WJSettings.BOUNDARY_AP or WJSettings.BOUNDARY_DV.
        offset - Takes values in [-1,1].
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
